class.rdfs:comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between Â£1,000 and Â£1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.
class.rdfs:label: MonetaryAmount

schema:currency.rdfs:comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format).
schema:currency.rdfs:label: currency

schema:maxValue.rdfs:comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.
schema:maxValue.rdfs:label: maxValue

schema:minValue.rdfs:comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.
schema:minValue.rdfs:label: minValue

schema:validFrom.rdfs:comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
schema:validFrom.rdfs:label: validFrom

schema:validThrough.rdfs:comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
schema:validThrough.rdfs:label: validThrough

schema:value.rdfs:comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

  • For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryAmount, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
  • For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
schema:value.rdfs:label: value
